docs.snippet: GENEVA, Nov. 20 (By Telephone to Paris).--The Assembly of the League of Nations was told today by Newton R. Rowell, a Canadian delegate, that the League could not expect the United States to join if it accepted the idea of the unity of the world in...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Nov. 20 (By Telephone to Paris).--The Assembly of the League of Nations was told today by Newton R. Rowell, a Canadian delegate, that the League could not expect the United States to join if it accepted the idea of the unity of the world in raw materials.

headline.main: WARNS LEAGUE AMERICA OPPOSES ALL INTERFERENCE; Canadian Delegate Replies Sharply to Suggestion of Equality in Raw Materials. LEAGUE ARMY PROPOSED Assembly Waits Now for Commissions to Report on Problems Submitted to Them.AN AMENDMENT SUGGESTED Dutch Would Clear Up Registration of Treaties--Many Nations UrgeSpanish as Official Language.
